title: Robert Irwin graduates from high school and completes two TAFE certificates
text:
At just 15, Robert Irwin is already a world-famous eco-warrior, an award-winning wildlife photographer and a popular TV personality.

And despite his busy schedule, Robert Irwin has found time to graduate from high school and complete two TAFE courses.

The son of the late Crocodile Hunter, Steve Irwin, shared the happy news on Instagram on Saturday, sharing a photo of himself at his computer while holding his adorable three-year-old pug Stella.

Schools out! Robert Irwin has shared on Instagram he graduated from high school with two TAFE certificates while he juggled working, wildlife conservation and travelling the last decade

'Well this is it. Over a decade of study - in planes, trains and thousands of hotel rooms in all corners of the world, and today I've graduated from high school,' he wrote.

'Grade 12 and 2 TAFE certificates done! Excited for what's ahead...'

Robert, alongside his sister Bindi, 21, and mother Terri, 55, have passionately continued the legacy of Steve since his shock death in 2006.

Family affair: Robert, Bindi and Terri have appeared on a number of talk shows across the US, including The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, to promote their nature show, Crickey! It's the Irwins

Eco-warrior: He's appeared as a special guest a number of times on Jimmy's show, bringing in animals to push the importance of wildlife conservation

The family have recently appeared on a number of talk shows across the US to spruik their nature show, Crikey! It's the Irwins, as well as promoting the importance of wildlife conservation.

Last month the teen revealed what happened behind the scenes during the moment Chandler Powell, 22, proposed to his sister Bindi.

Appearing as a special guest on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon in New York last month, he told how he and Chandler planned to capture the proposal moments after Bindi said 'yes'.

Practice makes perfect: Appearing as a special guest on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon in New York last month, he told how he and Chandler planned to capture the proposal moments after Bindi said 'yes'

'So, before we did it, Chandler came up to me, and of course he asked mum and I for our permission, but he also said 'I want to make sure it's perfect where I'm doing this proposal'', he told Jimmy.

He added: 'So I stood in for Bindi and mocked up where he was going to propose.'

'And Bindi hasn't even seen this photo but I've got it with me,' before Jimmy revealed the pictures.

authors: David Wu For Daily Mail Australia
